statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Iona beats Florida Gulf Coast 90-72 in shootout
article.headline: Iona beats Florida Gulf Coast 90-72 in shootout
article.linkText: Iona beats Florida Gulf Coast 90-72 in shootout
article.story: FORT MYERS, Fla. -- Tre Bowman scored a career-high 29 points and his team made 14 of 27 3-pointers Sunday afternoon, beating Florida Gulf Coast 90-72 in a shootout. Sean Armand scored 20 points, including a game-high five 3-pointers, for Iona (3-2), A.J. English scored 13 points and David Laury added 11. Bowman made four of six three-point attempts and the Gaels shot 51.9 percent from three-point range. Brett Comer led Florida Gulf Coast (4-3) with 20 points, Bernard Thompson had 17, Filip Cvjeticanin scored 15 and Chase Fieler, 14. The scored deadlocked at 20 in the first period, then Bowman led a 12-2 Iona run over the last 3:02 and the Gaels led 52-40 at halftime. Iona extended its lead to as much as 24 in the second half after Bowman led another 12-2 run and the squads traded baskets. The teams made 46 three-point attempts, with the Eagles converting 7 of 19.
